moves.1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. Nxe5 d6 4. Nxf7 K: All the games begin here. Material is even, and Black has an advantage in development but an exposed King position.
moves.9. O-O dxc5 10. Qe2: I prepare to thrust forward in the center...
moves.10... Bd6 11. f4 Kf7 12. e5: ...and I do, with a fork to boot.
moves.12... Nd4 13. Qc4+ Ne6 14. exd6: The dust has settled on the first skirmish...
moves.15... Rhe8 16. f5: Black's pinned Knight is a sitting duck.
moves.16... Re7 17. fxe6+: Now I'm a piece up and Black's other Knight is also pinned.
moves.17... Rxe6 18. Bg5: Adding more pressure to the pin.
moves.18... Rae8 19. Ne4: Taking advantage of the fact that Black's Rook on K3 is also pinned, I add yet more pressure to the Knight.
moves.19... Qd4+ 20. Qxd4: I'm not about to say no to exchanging Queens, given my material advantage.
moves.20... cxd4 21. Nxf6: Balck could limit his losses to a Pawn with 21... PxN 22 RxP.
moves.21... Rc8 22. Nd5+: Instead, he lets the Knight loose.
moves.22... Ke8 23. Rae1: Yet another pin! [Sensing a theme here?] Black is compelled to exchange a pair of Rooks to avoid further material loss.
moves.23... Rxe1 24. Rxe1+: Now it's just a matter of mopping up.
moves.24... Kd7 25. Nb4: To guard the QBP, and clear the rank for my Rook.
moves.25... Kc7 26. Re5: Seizing the rank, and threatening to eliminate Black's last piece with 27 R-B5 ch.
moves.28... dxc3 29. bxc3: Black's advanced Pawn is now eliminated.
moves.29... Rxc3 30. Bd8+: Black's only legal move, 30... R-B2, would lose the Rook to 31 BxR. Black resigns.
